Package main.java.scene

Class Color

java.lang.Object
main.java.scene.Color
public class Color extends Object
The Color class represents a color using RGB components.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Color(double r, double g, double b)
    Constructs a new Color with the specified RGB components.

  • Constructor Details

    • Color

      public Color(double r, double g, double b)
      Constructs a new Color with the specified RGB components.
      Parameters:
      r - The red component (in the range [0, 1]).
      g - The green component (in the range [0, 1]).
      b - The blue component (in the range [0, 1]).

  • Method Details

    • getR

      public double getR()
      Gets the red component of the color.
      Returns:
      The red component (in the range [0, 1]).

    • getG

      public double getG()
      Gets the green component of the color.
      Returns:
      The green component (in the range [0, 1]).

    • getB

      public double getB()
      Gets the blue component of the color.
      Returns:
      The blue component (in the range [0, 1]).

    • add

      public Color add(Color other)
      Adds another color to this color, component-wise.
      Parameters:
      other - The color to add.
      Returns:
      A new color resulting from the addition.

    • multiply

      public Color multiply(double scalar)
      Multiplies the color by a scalar value, component-wise.
      Parameters:
      scalar - The scalar value to multiply by.
      Returns:
      A new color resulting from the multiplication.

    • schurProduct

      public Color schurProduct(Color other)
      Computes the Schur product (component-wise multiplication) with another color.
      Parameters:
      other - The color to perform the Schur product with.
      Returns:
      A new color resulting from the Schur product.

    • isBlack

      public boolean isBlack()
      Checks if the color is black (all components are 0).
      Returns:
      true if the color is black, false otherwise.
